SQLStoredProcedureSpec.Name: USR_USP_POPULATE_RGDATE_UPDATE_TEMP_TABLE
SQLStoredProcedureSpec.Description: Populates the temp table used to populate RG Date column.
SQLStoredProcedureSpec.Author: Mark Sellers
SQLStoredProcedureSpec.CreateProcedureSQL: create procedure dbo.USR_USP_POPULATE_RGDATE_UPDATE_TEMP_TABLE as begin select c.LOOKUPID as SPONSORID, ft.CALCULATEDUSERDEFINEDID as RGID, min(rgi.[DATE]) as FIRSTINSTALLMENTDATE, cast(rs.STARTDATE as DATE) as REVENUESCHEDULE_STARTDATE, cast(rs.NEXTTRANSACTIONDATE as DATE) as NTD into dbo.USR_REVENUESCHEDULE_BEFORE_STARTDATE_UPDATE from dbo.CONSTITUENT c join dbo.FINANCIALTRANSACTION ft on ft.CONSTITUENTID = c.ID and ft.TYPECODE = 2 join dbo.REVENUESCHEDULE rs on rs.ID = ft.ID --and rs.[STATUS] = 'Active' -- is there any reason to further restict this to sponsorships? join dbo.RECURRINGGIFTINSTALLMENT rgi on rgi.REVENUEID = ft.ID group by c.LOOKUPID, ft.CALCULATEDUSERDEFINEDID, rs.STARTDATE, rs.NEXTTRANSACTIONDATE having min(rgi.date) < cast(rs.startdate as date) --and min(rgi.date) = rs.NEXTTRANSACTIONDATE order by c.LOOKUPID -- ft.calculateduserdefinedid end
